message.content: This question requires knowledge about the adaptations of birds to different environments. Penguins have a layer of insulating feathers that help them survive in cold Arctic weather. These feathers trap warm air close to the penguin's body, providing insulation against the cold temperatures. Option (A) is incorrect because while sunlight may provide some warmth, it is not the main reason why penguins can survive in Arctic weather. Option (B) is incorrect because bears are not related to the adaptations of penguins. Option (C) is too broad and does not specifically address the adaptations of penguins to cold weather.

This question requires knowledge about adaptations of birds to different climates. Penguins are able to survive in arctic weather due to their feathers. Penguin feathers are dense and overlapping, which helps to provide insulation and maintain body heat in cold temperatures. Option (A) is incorrect because sunlight alone would not be enough for a bird to survive in such extreme conditions. Option (B) is incorrect because bears are not related to the adaptive mechanisms of penguins. Option (C) is too vague and not specific to the survival of penguins in arctic weather.
